Organs/Tissues: Any barrier or 2-organ system with a porous membrane interface (lung, gut, BBB, etc.)
Physiological/Pathological: Both. Normal epithelial/endothelial barriers or diseased states (inflammation, infection)
Cell Source: User-chosen: primary or iPSC-derived epithelial/endothelial, plus immune cells if needed
Multiple Cell Types: Yes. Typically 2–3 cell types across membrane (epithelium on top, endothelium/immune below)
Stromal Cells: Optional (can add fibroblasts in one side). Not included by default
Tissue-resident Immune: Optional co-culture in one compartment. Example: macrophages or dendritic cells in the basal side
Circulating Immune: Yes, can flow immune cells in the vascular channel if desired
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): Yes, can link compartments in series for multi-organ synergy (e.g. liver–kidney)
Air-Liquid Interface: Possible by flowing air in top channel for lung model. Typically both channels perfused with medium
Extracellular Matrix: Yes, membrane coating or channel surfaces. Allows cell attachment/polarization
3D Scaffold: Generally 2D layering on membrane, but small 3D growth can occur on either side
Notable Features: Polymer chip (COC) with integrated porous PET membrane (8 μm pores). Minimal drug absorption. Luer connections for easy flow setup. Good for barrier models (gut, lung, BBB).
Plate/Format (Throughput): Each chip is ~slide size with 1–2 compartments. Low–medium throughput. Multiple chips can run in parallel
Max Culture Duration: Days to weeks under flow. Validated up to 28 days or more (liver, gut studies)
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes (transparent polymer, confocal feasible). Cells on membrane visible from top or bottom
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes, from perfusion outlets for metabolic/secreted markers
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Difficult (bonded chip). Usually in-chip analysis or destructive opening. In situ lysis for RNA/protein
Readouts - Whole Tissue: If membrane is retrieved by opening the chip, partial. Typically do on-chip imaging
Readouts - TEER: Not integrated. Possible by inserting electrodes or custom design
Readouts - MEA: No standard. Usually not integrated. Would require custom electrode addition
Readouts - Integrated Biosensors: No by default. Potential for custom O2 or pH sensors. Some examples in publications
Dead Volume: Low. ~0.4–0.5 mL per channel + minimal tubing
Perfused: Yes, continuous or intermittent flow via external pump or gravity. Luer ports
Gas Mix Controlled: Incubator environment. ALI possible if channel is air-filled
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Yes, can vary flow rate, composition, or link multiple chips
model_availability: Standard consumable chips. User provides cells & pumping. Also custom designs

Organs/Tissues: Any 3D tissue, organoid, or scaffold. Model e.g. liver organoid, tumor spheroid, cardiac patch
Physiological/Pathological: Both. Healthy or diseased 3D tissues. Long-term perfusion or repeated dosing
Cell Source: User-chosen 3D constructs: iPSC organoids, primary tumor spheroids, decellularized scaffolds, etc.
Multiple Cell Types: Yes, can embed multi-cell organoids or co-culture. 5 replicate units/chip for parallel tests
Stromal Cells: Yes, if included in the 3D construct. Chip accommodates fibroblasts, ECM, etc.
Tissue-resident Immune: Optional – can incorporate immune cells into organoid or add them into flow
Circulating Immune: Yes, can flow immune cells around 3D tissue for infiltration assays
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): Within one unit, just the single 3D tissue. For multi-organ, link multiple units or multiple chips
Air-Liquid Interface: Not typical. Usually submerged 3D scaffold. Possibly open top if user modifies seal
Extracellular Matrix: Yes, user can place scaffolds or hydrogels in the central chamber. ECM essential for 3D organoids
3D Scaffold: Core design – an open well for scaffolds or organoids, perfused from sides
Notable Features: Allows easy insertion & removal of 3D tissue. 5 parallel wells in one chip. Perfusion around each scaffold
Plate/Format (Throughput): Slide format with 5 units. Medium throughput. Parallel replicates or 5 conditions
Max Culture Duration: Weeks with continuous flow. Minimizes necrosis in center of organoids
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes, transparent. Access from top or bottom. Confocal possible for 3D structures
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes, each well’s effluent can be collected
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Yes, more feasible. User can peel seal & take out entire scaffold or organoid for post-analysis
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Yes, scaffold can be extracted intact for histology or further assays
Readouts - TEER: No direct barrier unless user inserts a membrane. No built-in electrodes
Readouts - MEA: No standard. Could integrate external electrode if custom. Typically not included
Readouts - Integrated Biosensors: None by default. Feasible custom solutions for O2 sensor, etc.
Dead Volume: Low, small channel volumes around scaffold. Minimizes reagent usage
Perfused: Yes, flow around the scaffold from inlet to outlet via Luer connectors
Gas Mix Controlled: Incubator-based. Can’t permeate walls, but flow is oxygenated from reservoir
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Yes, can change flow rates, add drugs, sample frequently, link multiple units in series
model_availability: Commercial consumable chip (Fluidic 1380). Users supply cells/scaffolds & pumps
